qas.question: In 1991, was a proposal for a new league postponed?

answers.text: At the close of the 1991 season, a proposal was tabled

qas.question: When was the Founder Members Agreement signed?

answers.text: The Founder Members Agreement, signed on 17 July 1991
established the basic principles for setting up the FA Premier League.

qas.question: Would the new top division have commerical independence from the Football Association as well as the Football League?

answers.text: The newly formed top division would have commercial independence from The Football Association and the Football League

qas.question: Would the FA Premier League be able to negotiate their broadcasting and sponsorship agreements?

answers.text: giving the FA Premier League licence to negotiate its own broadcast and sponsorship agreements.

qas.question: On which day was the Founder Members Agreement signed?
What was the argument made for the splitting off of the FA Premier League which would lead to being able to compete across Europe?
In which year was the proposal for a new league tabled?
When was the FA Premier League Agreement signed?
The FA Premier League established the basic principles for which agreement?

plausible_answers.text: The Football Association and the Football League

qas.question: The new division would be dependent on which association and league?
What would the extra income allow European clubs to do?
What was proposed at the beginning of the 1991 season?

context: <a0_0>At the close of the <a7_0>1991<a7_0/> season, a proposal was tabled<a0_0/> for the <b12_0>establishment of a new league<b12_0/> that would bring more money into the game overall. <a1_0>The <b9_0>Founder Members Agreement<b9_0/>, signed on <a5_0><b8_0>17 July 1991<b8_0/><a5_0/><a1_0/> by the game's top-flight clubs, <a2_0>established the basic principles for setting up the FA Premier League.<a2_0/> <a3_0>The newly formed top division would have commercial independence from <b10_0>The Football Association and the Football League<b10_0/><a3_0/>, <a4_0>giving the FA Premier League licence to negotiate its own broadcast and sponsorship agreements.<a4_0/> The argument given at the time was that the <a6_0>extra income<a6_0/> would allow English clubs to <b11_0>compete with teams across Europe.
